title: Business Live: Bitcoin passes $13,000 - BBC News
summary: cabinet not discussed brexit end point - hammond .
steinhoff shares plunge after boss quits .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for tonight - thanks very much for reading .
do join us in the morning when business live will be back from 06:00am .
on the diary we 've house prices figures from halifax , lending data from the bank of england and the latest eu growth estimates .

documents.title: in the throes of a bubble ?
text: we 'll finish with views on bitcoin 's latest surge , as the digital currency increases by $ 1,000 in the space of a day to break through $ 13,000 for the first time .
karl schamotta , a director at cambridge global payments in canada , says the entrance of major us exchange operators into the bitcoin market is `` driving the massive rally '' .
however , others are more blunt : saying that greed and fear are behind the surge .
`` we are in the throes of a bubble market , and one of the characteristics of a bubble market is that there is no way to know when the bubble will burst , '' said mick mccarthy of cmc markets .

documents.title: wall street slips on oil
text: the main us stock indexes have finished slightly lower , dragged down by energy stocks and falling oil prices .
west texas crude dropped 3 % to $ 55.98 a barrel , while brent crude slipped 2.6 % to $ 61.24 a barrel as data showed us production is rising faster than expected .
the dow jones share index dipped 0.2 % to 24140.91 , while the s & p 500 was flat at 2629.27 .
there was a modest gain in tech stocks , which saw the nasdaq index buck the trend to rise 0.2 % to 6776.38 .

documents.title: breakingex-volkswagen executive jailed for 7 years
text: a former volkswagen executive has been sentenced to seven years in prison and a $ 400,000 fine , after admitting to helping the firm evade clean-air laws .
oliver schmidt , 48 , is the second person to receive jail time in the us for his role in the diesel emissions scandal .
mr schmidt , who led vw 's environmental and engineering office in michigan and helped secure us regulatory approval , learned of the cheating scheme in 2015 , according to court documents .
volkswagen has said it installed software to cheat emissions tests in millions of vehicles globally .
it has spent as much as $ 30bn to address us claims .

documents.title: more valuable than coca cola
text: bitcoin 's latest surge means it 's now worth more than most of the biggest companies in the us - albeit the comparison is n't exact .
the market value of bitcoin ( which you get from multiplying the number of bitcoins in circulation with the crypto-currency 's price ) is now $ 224.8bn .
that gives it a higher market capitalisation than 97 % of the companies on the s & p index of the 500 largest us companies , according to analyst charlie bilello .
drinks giant coca-cola , drugs firm pfizer and citigroup - the world 's largest credit card issuer - all have a smaller market capitalisation than bitcoin 's , he said .

documents.title: the big issues around bitcoin
text: what are cryptocurrencies , how do they work and can you actually spend them ?
why have values risen so sharply and what are the risks ?
with uncanny timing , money box on bbc radio 4 looked at the big issues around bitcoin this afternoon
is bitcoin a great investment opportunity or a bubble about to burst ?
more bbc biased reporting on bitcoin .
reminds me of the same reporting of the internet in 1994 .
bitcoin gives people worldwide back their money without need for a trusted 3rd party like banks .

documents.title: bitcoin rises $ 1,000 in a day
text: to put bitcoin 's latest milestone in perspective , it has risen $ 1,000 in value in less than 24 hours ( see the chart above ) .
analysts suggested that a lot of new money was coming into the market looking for a profit - helped by the entry of major us exchanges .
others said the currency 's rise was unsustainable , and had the hallmarks of financial crazes like the dotcom boom .
`` it appears the bubble is growing at an increasing pace , '' said david cheetham , chief market analyst at xtb .
`` even the most ardent bitcoin bulls would struggle to justify the rationale behind the latest gains . ''

documents.title: breakingbitcoin passes $ 13,000
text: the dramatic surge in the price of bitcoin continues as it passes $ 13,000 for the first time .
the digital currency has seen its value double in the last month in a steep , but often volatile , rise .
it 's hit a new record high of $ 13,134.59 , according to the coindesk exchange .

documents.title: brexit no deal 'devastating ' - us body
text: a failure to reach a brexit deal would be `` devastating '' for uk and us companies , according to a major us business organisation .
the us chamber of commerce says it is calling for a transition period of at least three years after march 2019 - when the uk is due to leave the eu - to negotiate a full uk-eu trade deal .
marjorie chorlins , director for the body 's us-uk business council , is appearing before congress to discuss the brexit negotiations .

`` if brexit is mismanaged , or if the uk crashes out of the eu without an agreement on their future relationship , the economic consequences would be substantial , and thousands of u.s. firms and their employees would be directly affected , '' she said in pre-prepared comments .

documents.title: eu workers 'in limbo '
text: on # brexit talks , employers @ twitterid & unions @ twitterid say they 're `` deeply concerned that our friends , colleagues & workers continue to be in limbo '' .
they say eu citizens `` deserve better treatment , given their vital contribution to our communities , businesses & public services ''

documents.title: unilever fined in ice-cream row
text: unilever 's italian division has been hit with a €60m fine for for abusing its dominant position in the market for packaged ice-cream .
italy 's competition agency launched a probe after a small ice lolly maker called la bomba complained the giant consumer goods firm was forcing local retailers not to sell its lollies .
the investigation concluded that unilever had obliged or incentivised '' local firms to exclusively sell its ice-creams .
unilever has rejected the finding and said it will appeal .

`` the market for ice cream ( to be consumed ) outside the home is a highly competitive one in which artisan and industrial , bulk and packaged products compete for the consumer 's attention in a fragmented landscape that is like no other in europe , '' unilever said .

documents.title: festive fairy tale
text: telegraph cartoonist matt 's inimitable take on the government saying it has n't carried out impact assessments of brexit on the uk economy .

none of you posturing 's are the truth .

documents.title: video game watchdog in hot water
text: the video standards council ( vsc ) has been accused of not doing its job , because it apparently has n't banned a single title since it became the official video games regulator for the uk in 2012 .

`` the video standards council is more like a trade organisation than a regulatory body and uses a very light touch approach to classifying video games , and this does not meet the concerns of parents , '' liberal democrat peer and former headteacher lord storey told the house of lords .
`` in fact there have been no videos which have not been available or removed from the shelves . ''

however , ministers said that there was no evidence that the watchdog had not done its job , saying that the vsc classified 146 out of 498 video games in 2016 as `` 18 '' , meaning that only adults were permitted to purchase them and play them .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: guardian goes tabloid
text: a little # r4mediashow scoop on @ twitterid as @ twitterid reveals the guardian tabloid edition will be launched on january 15th
booooo !
good scoop !
any special plans for p3 ?
is the observer going tabloid too ?

documents.title: walmart to rebrand ( sort of )
text: walmart has decided to rebrand itself from `` walmart stores '' to `` walmart inc '' , to reflect its online business , which encompasses mobile shopping , as well as and delivery .
the us supermarket chain announced that the change will be effective from february 2018 .
`` our customers know us as walmart and today they shop with us not only in our stores but online and with our app as well , '' said chief executive doug mcmillon
walmart has 11,600 stores around the world .
it will continue to trade on the new york stock exchange under the symbol 'wmt ' .

documents.title: ryanair shrugs off portugal threat
text: the irish airline is n't only facing industrial action in italy - where dozens of pilots are planning to walk out on 15 december - but in portugal too .
portuguese union spac has served formal notice of its ryanair members voting in favour of industrial action .
the portuguese pilots also plan a strike later this month , according to reports in irish media .
in response , ryanair told the bbc : `` we have never suffered any strikes .
we regularly receive threats of industrial action from competitor airline pilot unions from italy , portugal and even aer lingus pilots occasionally .
`` both we and our pilots ignore these letters . ''

documents.title: 'dear mark carney capitalism stinks '
text: the bbc has seen some of the angry letters sent to bank of england governor mark carney .
here are some of the publishable extracts - which were obtained through a freedom of information request :

documents.title: strike will be dropped - ryanair
text: ryanair has poured cold water on the likelihood of a strike by its italian pilots taking place next week .
this is the sixth time fit/cisl or anpac has announced strikes by ryanair pilots , only to postpone/cancel them later , '' a spokeswoman for the airline says .
`` we expect this latest threatened strike will also be postponed/cancelled since both fit/cisl and anpac are alitalia unions with no role in ryanair , '' she adds .

documents.title: productivity versus employment
text: what 's more important - higher employment or higher productivity ?
according to philip hammond it 's employment .

the chancellor told mps grilling him over last month 's budget that while the uk has `` a fundamental productivity problem '' , the government 's approach since the financial crisis has been to `` encourage employment growth '' .
`` other economies have chosen different routes where high levels of employment are tolerated the effects of which will be felt for years to come .
`` i think we 've made the right decision , '' he said .
the uk 's poor productivity has been blamed for holding back the uk economy .

in last month 's budget the government 's economic watchdog , the office for budget responsibility ( obr ) , said productivity has grown by just 0.2 % a year for the past five years , much less than expected .
it also warned productivity will see only weak growth in the next five years .

documents.title: ryanair faces first ever strike
text: budget airline ryanair could see its first ever strike next week , according to an italian union .
italian union anpac has announced plans for its members to strike on 15 december from 14.00 gmt to 18.00 gmt .
the union has 280 members , representing around 40 % of the ryanair pilots based in italy .
anpac said it was not yet clear how many of its pilots were scheduled to fly at that time .
but ryanair is dismissive of the threat , saying it does n't expect the walkout to go ahead .

documents.title: trump : us can hit 6 % growth
text: donald trump has said he `` sees no reason '' why the us ca n't double its economic growth to 6 % - a rate it has n't hit for more than 15 years .
the president said that without the impact of hurricanes harvey and irma , economic growth would already be at 4 % - a jump that he put down to his economic policies .
`` we 're at 3.3 % .
i see no reason why we do n't go to 4 , 5 even 6 % , '' trump said during televised comments from a cabinet meeting .
he added that he could n't wait to sign `` giant '' tax cuts going through congress , which would help to boost the economy further .
his comments came ahead of a major announcement on israel due later today when it 's expected the president will recognise jerusalem as the country 's capital .

documents.title: brexit impact assessments 'do n't exist '
text: brexit impact assessments 'do n't exist '

documents.title: ftse gets a coffee hit
text: the uk 's 100 share index finished in positive territory after an afternoon boost , helped by a rise in shares of costa coffee owner whitbread .
the ftse 100 rose 20 points , or 0.3 % , to 7348.03 points .
whitbread topped the leaderboard , rising 7.5 % after an activist investor took a sizeable stake in the business .
analysts said the index was also helped by a fall in sterling and a modest recovery in mining stocks .
many of the ftse 100 's firms make their money abroad , which is then worth more when converted back into sterling if the pound is weaker .

documents.title: the uk 's biggest pub landlord
text: speaking of tim martin , the outspoken founder of the wetherspoon 's pub chain was on this week 's desert islands discs on radio 4 .
along with his song choices - which included dire straits ' sultans of swing and bob marley 's natural mystic - he also admitted that he was a useless publican at the start of his career .
he opened his first pub , martin 's free house , in 1979 in north london .
now the chain employs 37,000 people , in 891 pubs of which 54 are hotels .
he spent his childhood in both new zealand and northern ireland , as his father - initially an aerobatic pilot and later a guinness employee - took the family around the world .
he trained for the law but instead chose the career of a pub owner .
`` i was so bad `` tim martin , wetherspoon boss , on the beginning of his pub career : # desertislanddiscs
no need to maroon tim on a desert island , he 's doing his best to turn uk into one as a # brexit fanatic .
# desertislanddiscs
he made me chuckle !
very entertaining did !

documents.title: wetherspoon boss : scrap food tariffs
text: tim martin , founder of pub chain wetherspoon 's and a high-profile brexit supporter , has told mps that the uk should eliminate all food tariffs after it leaves the european union .
such a move will lead to lower prices for consumers , and is allowed under world trade organization rules , he said in an environment , food and rural affairs committee hearing .
but what about the damaging impact on british farmers if the eu continues to charge tariffs on british food exports ?

`` it might be difficult for some - you ca n't rule that out - but i believe british farmers would do well , '' mr martin said , pointing to the example of new zealand lamb farmers who became more efficient after the uk started charging tariffs .
neil parish , the committee 's chair , counters that uk farming does n't have the same natural advantages as new zealand , and that export tariffs would be a major blow to the industry .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: 'a chaos we have n't seen yet '
text: the bbc 's political editor suggests the reason theresa may 's cabinet has n't discussed the end state for the brexit talks yet ( see earlier posts ) is because the prime minister has been trying to `` keep the show on the road '' .
there are many pitfalls lying in wait for when her ministers - many of whom are split on how close the uk should be to the eu after it leaves - do have that discussion , laura kuenssberg adds .
but in real life , it 's not impossible at all , putting off the conversation is the way that may has chosen to keep the show on the road
and by delaying the discussion , she 's delaying the potential bust ups , or resignations , or chaos of a kind that we have n't seen yet
for all that it has been extremely rocky , and to use whitehall speak , sub-optimal , govt has not been losing votes , or ministers over brexit , and has just about contained rebellions

documents.title: pret ups its coffee cup discount
text: in the interests of bbc impartiality , it 's only fair to follow up that news about costa with an update from another major high street coffee chain .
pret a manger has announced it 's increasing the discount for bringing in a reusable cup to 50p from the first week in january .
since august , pret has offered customers 25p off their coffee if they bring a reusable cup that it can be served in .
it comes as campaigners call for a large cut in the number of takeaway coffee cups we use , because only a tiny percentage are recyclable .

documents.title: caffeine kick
text: away from westminster , shares in the owner of costa coffee have had a mid-afternoon
whitbread 's stock is up nearly 7 % after a new york-based activist investment fund , sachem head , took a 3.4 % stake in the hotel and coffee chain operator .
it follows recent speculation that an activist investor could push whitbread to separate its costa coffee and premier inn hotel businesses .
credit suisse analysts gave a range of possible options in october for unlocking more value from whitbread , including spinning off costa or selling the firm 's brewers fayre and beefeater pubs .

documents.title: davis raises questions over brexit planning
text: mps hoped to hear painstaking assessments had been carried out on the impact of leaving the eu but what the brexit secretary had to tell them was rather different .
john pienaar suggests that for a famously genial minister , david davis seems to have developed the art of upsetting mps with doubts about brexit into a science .
read his analysis here .
author: John Pienaar
Deputy political editor

documents.title: should brexit models be made public ?
text: there 's a long running row in parliament over the government 's impact assessments from brexit , and its perceived unwillingness to publish them .

chancellor philip hammond tells mps : `` when we get to the point where we have a deal negotiated and agreed and it is being put before parliament , i think at that stage the maximum amount of analysis being placed in the public domain would be helpful . ''
but he also says : `` at this stage , when we have n't even begun the negotiation yet , i 'm afraid that to put our analysis in the public domain would be deeply unhelpful to the negotiation .
`` there is no decision for parliament to make at this stage .
parliament 's decision point will be when the government has negotiated a deal and is presenting it to parliament for endorsement . ''

documents.title: hammond : we have modelled brexit arrangements
text: brexit secretary david davis raised quite a few eyebrows earlier when he said the government had not carried out any impact assessments of leaving the eu on the uk economy .
he said the government had produced a `` sectoral analysis '' of different industries but not a `` forecast '' of what would happen when the uk leaves the eu .
mps have asked chancellor philip hammond to clear up the issue - which he has , up to a point .

`` of course we have modelled and analysed a wide range of potential alternative structures between the eu and the uk , potential alternative arrangements and agreements that might be made , '' mr hammond said .
`` that analysis is ongoing and will inform our negotiating position with the eu , '' he added .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: wall street opens lower
text: over on wall street , us stock indexes have dipped in early trading as technology stocks declined on concerns over stretched valuations and the impact of us corporate tax reforms .
the tech-heavy nasdaq composite index dropped 0.3 % to 6,741.46 .
the dow jones industrial average fell 0.05 % to 24,168.89 , while the s & p 500 lost 0.1 % to 2,625.76 .

documents.title: what 's the end game ?
text: has the cabinet discussed what the end state should be when the uk leaves the european union ?
chancellor philip hammond says ministers have had general discussions about the brexit negotiations but not specifically talked about what the final outcome should be .
that will happen when the uk and eu move on to the second stage of brexit negotiations , he tells mps on the treasury select committee .
theresa may had hoped to announce an agreement on monday to move onto those talks , but had to delay after opposition from her northern irish partners , the dup .

documents.title: dates for the diary
text: and do n't forget what will be a very interest scottish budget next week on 14 december
indeed paul .
date for your diary @ twitterid says tuesday 13th march will be the first spring statement .
very much not a budget he says .
if his mob are still in power , that is .
or if he is still in the job .

documents.title: breakingspring statement on 13 march
text: chancellor philip hammond announces that the next fiscal statement - now known as the spring statement - will be on tuesday 13 march .
for the last 20 years , the chancellor has delivered the budget in the spring .
however , mr hammond has changed that so the budget is now delivered in the autumn .

the statement will not be a `` major fiscal event '' , but will instead discuss longer-term issues and set out the latest official economic forecasts , mr hammond tells mps on the treasury select committee .

documents.title: 'take the challenge head on '
text: mps on the treasury select committee start by asking the chancellor about the grim forecasts for economic growth in last month 's budget .
philip hammond says the cuts in growth largely came about because the office for budget responsibility slashed its expectations for uk productivity .
he says the government recognises there 's `` a productivity problem in this country '' .
as a country `` we should take the challenge head on '' and demonstrate we can do better , he says .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: hammond 's jetset lifestyle
text: chancellor philip hammond 's appearance before the treasury select committee is due to start any minute now .
one question he might hope does n't come up is a story in the times this morning that he has been using mod jets and helicopters to fly to locations including dudley and wolverhampton .
twitter wags have been trying to work out where they might land .
you can get a jet to wolverhampton ?
does it land on the a4123 ?
ellycopter ter the topper the mander centre ay it , then off for a point o banks 's at the posada .
probably confused heath town with heathrow or wightwick with gatwick .
now need to translate the budget .
surely on tettenhall green .
maybe in the middle of the pool .
i would choose a jet to get in and out of dudley
what about dudley ? !
has the zoo got a heli pad ?
cosford and also the best free museum ever
no , at merry hill international
lands on the roof of lakshmis on dudley road
bobbington .
wolverhampton international .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks ben and dearbail for this morning 's coverage .
i 'll be taking us through the afternoon and into the evening .
first up , the chancellor will be in front of mps on the treasury select committee .
philip hammond may well face questions about the admission from brexit secretary david davis that the government has n't carried out any impact assessments of brexit on the uk economy .
mr davis ' comments have been the talk of westminster this lunchtime , with labour leader jeremy corbyn calling the government a `` shambles '' .
author: Dan Macadam
BBC business reporter

documents.title: sausage roll row
text: here 's one timed to fit in with people 's lunch break .
meat substitute company quorn foods will change its sausage roll packaging after a twitter complaint was shared tens of thousands of times .
dan douglas drew attention to an asterisk on a packet of 12 of the meat substitute snacks at a supermarket in sydenham , london .
following the asterisk , he pointed out the pack contained three sausage rolls which the labelling recommended could be served as `` 12 mini rolls when cut into 4 's . ''
`` have you ever seen anything so brazen ? ''
asked mr douglas .
read more here .

documents.title: us firms create 190,000 jobs
text: us companies created 190,000 jobs in november , down from 235,000 positions in october , according to payroll processor adp .
the figures are released ahead of non-farm payrolls data on friday which are expected to rise by between 200,000 and 240,000 .

documents.title: money for your life
text: there 's a lot of money to be made by livestreaming your life
live stream your death awh should parents have the rights to live streaming birth on greytime tv
and by lying ?

documents.title: bitcoin : 'nothing but sentiment '
text: as you can see it 's been an unbelievable month for bitcoin .
but many analysts remain sceptical about the cryptocurrency .
lilian chovin , an investment strategist at coutts said bitcoins rise reminds her of the dotcom bubble at the turn of the century .

`` as an investment asset , electronic currencies like bitcoin have nothing but sentiment backing them up , are vulnerable to government sanctions and lack the kind of data we look for to gauge value .
we therefore have no current plans to include them in our investment strategy . ''

documents.title: city watchdog fines broker over independence claim
text: the city watchdog has fined bluefin insurance services , a broker owned by axa uk , £ 4m for misleading its customers over its independence .
the financial conduct authority said that bluefin `` held itself out to be 'truly independent ' in the advice it provided and the insurers it recommended to customers '' .
however , it said the broker `` failed to implement adequate systems and controls to manage the conflict that arose from bluefin 's ownership '' .

mark steward , executive director of enforcement and market oversight at the fca , said : `` insurance brokers must promote a culture in which they act in their customers ' best interests and provide them with the information they need to make an informed decision .
this is central to the relationship between the industry and its customers .
`` it is also unacceptable that firms hold themselves out as independent when they are not . ''

documents.title: oil prices fall on higher us stocks
text: oil prices have fallen following a surprise rise in us inventories .
brent crude is down 1 % at $ 62.25 a barrel while west texas intermediate is off 1.2 % at 56.91 .
market analysts had expected the us to report a drop in stockpiles .
however , the american petroleum institute said gasoline stocks rose by 9.2 million barrels in the week to 1 december .
it also reported an increase of 4.3 million barrels in distillate inventories , which include motor diesel and heating oil .

documents.title: bitcoin still above $ 12,500
text: bitcoin had a bit of a wobble earlier , but is still trading 8 % higher at $ 12,669 .
the chart above shows the last 12 hours .

documents.title: markets : ftse 100 recovers ; hammerson down
text: the ftse 100 has recovered from early losses and has crept into positive territory .
british land , british american tobacco and tesco are all up more than 1 % .
hammerson is one of the biggest losers , down almost 2 % after it announced a deal to buy rival shopping centre owner , intu .
intu , listed on the ftse 250 , has soared 20 % .
the other big mover on that index is saga , which plunged 25 % after a profit warning .

documents.title: new cash for cheltenham racecourse
text: jockey club extends £ 25m racecourse bond

documents.title: bitcoin in reverse
text: neil wilson is the senior market analyst at etx capital .
# bitcoin down about $ 500 in 3 mins .
brave new world
all that volatility must be interesting for etx .
well there are a lot of longs
welcome to the crypto world .
normal day
these $ 500 price swings are starting to become irrelevant .

documents.title: apple 'optimistic ' over pulled china apps
text: the boss of apple is hopeful that apps pulled from its online store in china will be re-instated .
in november , skype 's call and messaging service was one of a number removed from apple 's app store in china after the government said it does not comply with local law .
speaking at the fortune forum in guangzhou , apple 's chief executive tim cook , said : `` my hope over time is that some of the things , the couple of things that 's been pulled , come back .
i have great hope on that and great optimism on that . ''

documents.title: investors brace for sterling volatility
text: commenting on the pound , william anderson jones , head of uk corporate dealing at rationalfx , says : `` the uncertainty on the progress of negotiations is beginning to have an impact on more than just sterling .
`` a group of german firms have signaled their unease and intention to reconsider their trade links if progress does not become clear . ''

he adds : `` with the december eu summit approaching next week , investors will be bracing themselves for further movement and volatility , with the pound being driven by events at westminster in the coming days. ``

documents.title: pound falls on stalled brexit talks
text: concerns over a lack of progress on a brexit deal continues to weigh on sterling .
the pound is trading 0.44 % lower on the dollar at $ 1.33840 .
it is down 0.4 % on the euro at €1.13200 .

john marley , head of fx strategy at infinity international , says : `` the eu have said they need to know by this week what the position of the uk is , as they need to prepare for the summit next week and markets are a bit nervous . ''
for more coverage on brexit , click here .

documents.title: 'wowzers '
text: retail week 's head of content luke tugby and analyst jonathan de mello react to hammerson 's £ 3.4bn offer for intu .
wowzers .
shopping centre landlord hammerson to acquire rival intu , creating a £ 21bn business .
hammerson ceo david atkins to run the enlarged group , david tyler to remain as chairman
blimey !
massive property news - @ twitterid to take over @ twitterid - will be a true merger of giants creating by far the biggest shopping centre owner in the uk

documents.title: analysis : hammerson fulfils its quest
text: the union of hammerson and intu - the company formerly known as capital shopping centres - has been the holy grail of property investment for more than a decade .

the relative under-performance on intu shares , which have at times traded at a discount to book value as high as 50 % , has brought an opportunity for david atkins , hammerson 's ambitious chief executive .
the other key factor was the willingness of john whittaker , the secretive billionaire who was the big shareholder in intu , to come to the table .
the end result is a shopping centre monster - £ 21bn worth of assets across europe - that will quickly weed out underperforming properties once the deal is done .
author: Dominic O'Connell
Business Presenter, BBC Radio 4 Today programme

documents.title: davis : no review of impact of brexit on sectors
text: brexit minister david davis has been answering questions posed by a parliamentary committee .
this from faisal islam , sky news political editor :
david davis at dexeu special committee on the impact studies says there arent any impact studies in the form they are defined by the better regulation taskforce , are sectoral studies
benn : has the government done impact assessments on leaving the eu for individual sectors ?
davis : not in sectors theres no systematic impact assessments benn : automotive ?
davis : no benn : aerospace ?
davis : no .
no on all of them
davis : i 'm not a fan of economic models because they 're all proven wrong is a paradigm change

davis : when we started the impact assessments , err sectoral analyses , didnt know if we were going to do a negotiation sector by sector now overall so actual impact assessments as you term it is not necessary piece by piece
davis says that will do impact assessments as go into phase 2 to inform negotiation , eg on agriculture , but wo n't release publicly
davis : just because you use the word impact does not mean you have done an impact assessment
davis implicitly criticises then chief whip for not voting against the opoosition day binding motion - as i recall this occurred hours before his elevation to defence secretary
davis facing what sounds like a hanging jury here on possible contempt issues re binding motion
davis somewhat on the backfoot re : what assessment was available and precisely when and to whom , what was a summary , what was quantitative , what was excruciating detail
surely davis ca n't keep his job .
not that he 's started it yet .
and how can anyone believe in sunny uplands and easy trade deals when there is no analysis , no evidence , no vision of the shape and size of the economy of the uk in the future ?
never again can they say `` trust me
yet it is do detailed that it hurts .
good greif .
i had fogotten that .
he is in utter contempt .
benn : ah well thats ok then .
we wont hold you in contempt of parliament .
then mps wonder why public so distrust them .
shameful and disgraceful .
but he said he had done them ? ? ?
it 's as if that was a lie ? ?
surely not ?
this is the monty python cheese emporium .
stilton ?
not as such .
contradicts previous statement therefore he 's in contempt - `` examples of contempt include giving false evidence to a parliamentary committee ''
what 's the consequence of being in contempt of parliament ?
suspension or expulsion
does n't seem serious enough !
i doubt either will happen anyway maybe timeout on the naughty step for david
i think a large number of mps will be very angry about this .
being lied to is n't something they 're likely to drop

documents.title: indian economy to accelerate
text: business reporter sameer hashmi tweets :
rbi - 'expect the indian economy to grow by 7 % & 7.8 % in the next two quarters respectively .
retains economic growth outlook at 6.7 % for this financial year ( april 17 - march 18 ) ' .
# rbipolicy
if its obviously doing so well , why are we supporting the country with overseas aid ?
surely this can only be so our selfserving politicians can sleep at night

documents.title: 'fear and greed ' propels bitcoin higher
text: one bitcoin is now worth a record $ 12,530.86 ( £ 9,353.27 ) after the cryptocurrency extended gains to rise 7.14 % .
`` there is a lot of money flowing into bitcoin right now , mostly motivated by `` fear of missing out '' and greed , '' says leonhard weese , president of the bitcoin association of hong kong .
us regulators said last week that they would allow two traditional exchanges - cme group and cboe global markets - to begin trading bitcoin futures later this month .

documents.title: court victory for luxury goods firms
text: luxury goods firms have won a significant court battle over how their products are sold .
europe 's top court has ruled that us cosmetics firm coty can block retailers from selling its goods online .
coty brands include rimmel and covergirl .
`` such a prohibition is appropriate and does not , in principle , go beyond what is necessary to preserve the luxury image of the goods , '' the court of justice of the european union said .
online retailers such as amazon and ebay have argued that curbing online sales is anti-competitive and hurts small businesses .

documents.title: what is steinhoff and what happened ?
text: more on the turmoil at steinhoff international , the south african owner of poundland and many other brands .
yesterday the chief executive markus jooste resigned after nearly 20 years in charge .
he had overseen the company 's expansion from a furniture manufacturer to one of the biggest retailers of household goods in the world .
the company had been under investigation over suspected accounting irregularities by german prosecutors since 2015 .
it is not clear whether that investigation is linked to possible accounting irregularities the company mentioned on tuesday .

documents.title: all go for sabre flotation
text: sabre has priced its initial public offering at 230p a share , valuing the insurance group at £ 575m .
sabre , whose brands include go girl insurance for women which offers `` handbag cover '' , had set a range of between 220-240p a share .
conditional trading - where shares are bought and sold by large investors such as fund managers before a company officially lists on the stock exchange - began today .
full admission is expected on 11 december .

documents.title: does deliveroo always pay the minimum wage ?
text: the boss of deliveroo is asked five times on breakfast whether some of its riders earn less than the minimum wage at certain times .
but dan warne , managing director , deliveroo uk & ireland , evades the question .
`` it is important to stress that we do give them a lot of understanding of when they should be working in order to make the maximum possible amount of money , '' is one of his answers .
he says that if a rider logs in at a slow time , 4pm for example , deliveroo will tell them that it is a `` soft period '' and they are likely to make less money than they would at peak .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: restaurant entrepreneur gets into mini-golf
text: luke johnson is the entrepreneur behind pizza express , giraffe and patisserie valerie .
last year he bought the palace pier brighton and now he has bought the chain of paradise island mini-golf venues .
why ?

`` traditional amusements are being re-invented for new generations because people do n't want to spend all their leisure time on a screen , they want to get out of the home and socialise , '' he says .
the mini-golf courses are in shopping centres which need new attractions to lure-in customers , who are switching to online shopping , he said .
`` increasingly shopping centres are going to become like leisure centres , '' said mr johnson .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: saga shares plunge on warning
text: saga 's share price plunged by 17.43 % to 149.7p in early trading after the insurance and holiday specialist for the over-50s issued a profit warning which it blamed , in part , on the collapse of monarch airlines .
the wider ftse 250 is down 139.11 points at 19,731.97 .
in contrast , shares in shopping centre-owner intu surged by 17.3 % to 233.5p following a £ 3.4bn takeover bid by hammerson .
hammerson is offering to pay 253.9p a share for intu .
investors sent hammerson 's stock down 4.3 % to 511.5p .
overall , the ftse 100 opened lower , down 29.73 points at 7,297.77 .

documents.title: hammerson and intu to sell £ 2bn worth of properties
text: hammerson is offering 253.9p per share for intu .
as part of the deal , the companies expect to make around £ 2bn worth of property disposals .
the deal between hammerson and intu will bring together some of the biggest shopping centres across the uk and the rest of europe .
hammerson owns the bullring in birmingham , known for its distinctive selfridges store , and brent cross in london while intu 's properties include the arndale centre in manchester .
the combined group will be known as hammerson .
it will be led by hammerson 's chief executive david atkins and its chairman david tyler .

documents.title: breakingbig deal among shopping centre owners
text: hammerson , the shopping centre owner , has made a recommended £ 3.4bn offer for intu , which owns manchester 's trafford centre .

documents.title: saga to make £ 10m in cost-savings
text: in a trading update , saga says underlying pre-tax profit will grow by between 1-2 % in the current financial year .
however , that does not take account of a one-off cost of £ 4m which the company expects to incur from implementing £ 10m of cost savings .

separately , the over-50s holiday and insurance specialist says it will invest £ 10m in marketing in the 12 months to january 2019 which , along with changes in its retail broker business , means underlying pre-tax profit will be 5 % below this current financial year .
chief executive lance batchelor , says : `` against a backdrop of some challenging trading conditions in our final quarter , we continue to develop the business for the long term . ''

documents.title: shares in tokyo fall 2 %
text: japanese shares led declines in a weak session for asian stock markets .
the benchmark nikkei 225 index sank 2 % , while south korea 's kospi index dropped 1.4 % .
australia 's s & p/asx 200 shed 0.4 % after the release of the country 's latest gdp figures .
hong kong 's hang seng index was down 1.3 % in morning trading .

documents.title: s korea to hike taxes for big firms
text: big firms and top earners in south korea will be hit by higher taxes from next year , according to the yonhap newsagency .
people who earn more than 500m south korean won ( $ 460,000 ; £ 340,000 ) will see their income rate rise from 40 to 42 % .
while taxes for those paid between 300m - 500m will increase from 38 to 40 % .
the highest corporate tax rate will jump from 22 to 25 % .
parliament approved the changes after passing a budget bill this week .
the finance ministry expects the tax hikes will raise an additional 3.4 trillion won for the government .

documents.title: stagecoach profits fall slightly
text: stagecoach has announced results for the half-year which ended 28 october 2017 .
on an adjusted basis pre-tax profits were down slightly at £ 96.7m , from £ 97.2m .
the company is the biggest operator of bus and coach services in the uk and owns the megabus.com brand .
it also runs the east midlands trains network .
in partnership with virgin trains it runs the east coast and west coast inter-city rail franchises .

documents.title: steinhoff shares plunge
text: shares in steinhoff international holdings , the owner of poundland , have plunged 61 % .
late on tuesday the south african furniture retailer announced that it had uncovered `` accounting irregularities '' that require further investigation .
it also said that its chief executive markus jooste had resigned and the publication of its accounts would be delayed .
the company has more than 12,000 stores in 30 countries .

documents.title: breakingmonarch collapse hits saga profits
text: saga , the over-50s travel and insurance specialist , has warned that underlying profits will grow at a slower than expected rate in the current financial year and will fall by 5 % in the following 12 months .

it said trading in the year to 31 january 2018 , `` has been impacted by more challenging trading in insurance broking during the period and the monarch airlines administration , which has affected our tour operations business '' .
it said the collapse will result in a one-off cost of £ 2m .

documents.title: australia : 26 years of growth and counting
text: australia'seconomy expanded at the fastest annual pace in more than a year last quarter , thanks to a jump in business investment .
gross domestic product grew by 0.6 % in the three months to september , just below expectations for a 0.7 % expansion .
the annual rate accelerated to 2.8 % , up from 1.9 % .
and thanks to a revision of the previous quarter 's growth - up from 0.8 % to 0.9 % - the aussie economy has now seen 26 years of uninterrupted growth without a recession .
but weakness in household spending clouds the outlook for future growth , as consumers battle high levels of debt and low wage growth .

documents.title: more flyers for easyjet
text: easyjet carried 5,350,245 passengers in november , up 8 % on last year .
its planes were also fuller , running at 92 % capacity , up from 89 % .

documents.title: shrinking print
text: as the uk 's newspaper industry continues to battle to maintain circulation numbers and advertising , does this mean there will be more consolidation ?
newsworks boss vanessa clifford says : `` we 're fairly unique in this country .
we have 20 national newspapers - no other country in the world has that quantity .
`` i think that yes , there will be more consolidation .
where it will be , though , is anyone 's guess . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: a captive audience
text: vanessa clifford , chief executive at newsworks , the newspapers ' trade body , says it is a lot easier to measure how effective advertising has been online as opposed to a newspaper .
but she says : `` to a degree , it is an illusion of precision .
there is a belief that because there 's lots of data there we know exactly what we 're doing with it - it 's not always the case . ''
ms clifford says : `` we now can prove with print and news brands how much attention people are paying to them .
we know that you ca n't do anything else when you 're reading pretty much , maybe listen to the radio .
so 60 % of people when they are reading a newspaper are doing just that . ''
that , she says , can be effective when engaging people with advertising .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: life in the old dog yet ?
text: is printed media dead ?
dmgt , owner of the daily mail , spooked investors last week when it warned of a rocky year ahead .

steve goodman at group m , a media buying agency , says that a decline in advertising in newspapers is partly down to the `` shiny new digital medium , particularly google and facebook hoovering up most of the incremental budgets that are out there in the market '' .
he tells the bbc 's today programme : `` that combined with a general gloom around circulation declines has meant that planners and clients look to other ways to reach their audience . ''
although on the upside , he says that newspapers have a higher rate of engagement than websites and have that `` quality trusted environment '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: bitcoin hits new high
text: bitcoin has reached a new high overnight and is trading 5.46 % higher at $ 12,334.97 , according to news site coindesk .
the value of the crypto-currency has swung wildly in recent weeks .
mick mccarthy , chief market strategist at cmc markets , says : `` it took a long time to establish the methodology and the way bitcoin was traded .
the original appeal came from the fact they were unregulated .
however it 's clearly moved out of those shadows and into centre stage . ''
but he adds : `` we are in the throes of a bubble market , and one of the characteristics of a bubble market is that there is no way to know when the bubble will burst . ''

documents.title: 'treasury banned from using mod planes '
text: on its front page , the times reports that the treasury has been banned from using raf jets and helicopters , until it settles a bill with the ministry of defence .
the treasury is said to owe a `` six-figure '' sum , according to the report .
the times says this row is part of a bigger battle over cuts at the ministry of defence .
the report says mr hammond has been accused of saying that the army only needs 50,000 troops - it currently has more than 77,000 .

documents.title: northern ireland companies could move south
text: if there was to be a hard border between northern ireland and the republic then you are likely to see businesses in the north moving to south , says simon devlin , managing director of full circle , a managament consultancy in belfast .
`` we work with many companies across northern ireland including many border towns and cities .
`` is it likely many of them will relocate 10 miles over the border if we end up with a hard brext ? ''
`` i would think it 's a very distinct possibility and that would have very significant implications for the northern ireland economy in terms of employment and output . ''
author: 5 Live

documents.title: 'shock ' at banks ' treatment of struggling customers
text: more than two million people are trapped in a constant cycle of overdraft borrowing according to the charity step change .
for many the problems can become serious , the charity says three quarters of those it surveyed had been permanently overdrawn for at least a year before asking for for help .

`` when we asked our clients what their experiences were , we were quite shocked that a lot of them were hit by these expensive unarranged charges and were also being pushed further into debt by overdraft borrowing , '' said laura rodrigues from the charity step change .
`` we really need banks to step in and be proactive in identifying where people are struggling and giving them a way out . ''
author: 5 Live
